items.title: Agri Picks Report April 03, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The sowing of summer crops in Gujarat fell 1.2% on year to 986,388 hectares as of Tuesday from 998,436 hectares sown in the corresponding period last year, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.description: The hotel industry is experiencing an up-cycle while there is a shift in consumer preference towards premium properties

items.title: Kirloskar Oil Engines shares in focus on order win from Defence Ministry
items.description: Kirloskar Oil Engines Share Price | The company will design and develop inhouse, medium speed engines, scalable from 3 MW to 10 MW and the developed engines will be used for Main Propulsion and Power Generation on ships of Indian Navy and Indian Coast Guard.

items.title: Bharat Electronics shares in focus on signing contract of Rs 593cr with Indian Air Force
items.description: Bharat Electronics Share Price | The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 340.35 and a 52-week low of Rs 218.30 on 10 July, 2024 and 04 April, 2024, respectively.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Sensex, Nifty off day's low; mid, smallcaps recover, IT drags, pharma outshine
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Bajaj Auto, Infosys, TCS, HCL Technologies, Tech Mahindra are among major losers on the Nifty, while gainers are Sun Pharma, Dr Reddy's Labs, Cipla, Power Grid Corp, Shriram Finance. Among sectors, auto, IT indices down 1-2 percent, while healthcare index up 4%. BSE Midcap and smallcap indices recovers from day's low and trading flat.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade CAMS, Nippon Life India, Aditya Birla Capital, Indian Hotels, Shyam Metalics, Supriya Life, and others on April 3?
items.description: The market is expected to react negatively to the 26% discounted reciprocal tariff on India announced by Donald Trump, but some buying can't be ruled out at lower levels. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on April 2
items.description: Benchmark indices settled higher in today's trading session, snapping their 2-day losing steak ahead of the US reciprocal tariff announcement.

items.title: SEBI finalizes proposal to stop the misuse of prop trading terminals
items.description: The policy has been broadly finalized and shared with stakeholders. Exchanges will be asked to implement it after taking input from brokers

items.description: Tata Consumer, Zomato, Titan Company, IndusInd Bank, Maruti Suzuki were among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers were Bharat Electronics, UltraTech Cement, Nestle India, Power Grid Corp and L&T.

items.title: Sensex jumps nearly 600 pts, Nifty above 23,300 ahead of Trump tariff decision; all sectors in green
items.description: The broader market echoed the upbeat sentiment, with the Nifty Midcap 100 climbing 1.61 percent and the Smallcap 100 gaining 1.2 percent.

items.title: Syngene| Time to consider this CRDMO player?| Stock of the Day
items.description: Syngene, subsidiary of Biocon, is the leading CRDMO (contract research, development, and manufacturing organisation) player of India. Its re-search and manufacturing facilities are located at Bangalore, Hyderabad and Mangalore. Company gets bulk of the revenue from the USA and Europe and runs dedicated R&D centres for Amgen, Baxter and BMS. In recent years, it has forayed into commercial manufacturing apart from the CRO (Contract Research Organization) services

items.title: Paytm partners with Hyderabad municipality to install devices for settling property tax
items.description: Paytm has deployed over 400 digital payment devices in collaboration with the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation to streamline property tax collection. The initiative aims to boost efficiency in tax collection, said parent company One 97 Communications.

items.title: Central Bank of India shares slide nearly 10% post-QIP; here's what analysts say
items.description: Shares of Punjab & Sind Bank, Indian Overseas Bank were also trading lower post-QIP

items.title: Retailers V-Mart, Baazar Style, V2 Retail surge up on strong business updates
items.description: Baazar Style, V-Mart and V2 Retail shared strong business updates, sending shares higher, with the positive sentiment rubbing off on other peers like Vishal Mega Mart and DMart as well.

items.title: MCX shares recover after early fall, Morgan Stanley and UBS issue contrasting notes
items.description: Morgan Stanley remains cautious with an 'Underweight' rating on MCX, while UBS has maintained a 'Buy' stance but revised its price target lower. Investors are awaiting clarity on regulatory approval for MCX's weekly options, which could offer upside potential for the exchange.

items.title: Buy HDFC Life Insurance Co; target of Rs 870: Ventura Securities
items.description: Ventura Securities is bullish on HDFC Life Insurance Co has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 870 in its research report dated March 28, 2025.

items.title: Sensex up 400 pts, Nifty above 23,250 as bank, IT stocks shine; mid, smallcaps outperform
items.description: Market experts suggest that Trump tariffs could help exacerbate inflationary pressure, limiting the US Federal Reserve's ability to moderate interest rates.
